partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title: SECTION D OTHER RULES
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule: When rule 21 or 22 applies between two boats, Section A rules do not.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title:
SECTION D OTHER RULES
21 OTHER RULES
21.1 STARTING ERRORS; TAKING PENALTIES; BACKING A SAIL
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule:
A boat sailing towards the pre-start side of the starting line or one of its extensions after her starting signal to start or to comply with rule
30.1 shall keep clear of a boat not doing so until her hull is completely on the pre-start side.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title:
SECTION D OTHER RULES
21 OTHER RULES
21.2 STARTING ERRORS; TAKING PENALTIES; BACKING A SAIL
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule: A boat taking a penalty shall keep clear of one that is not.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title:
SECTION D OTHER RULES
21 OTHER RULES
21.3 STARTING ERRORS; TAKING PENALTIES; BACKING A SAIL
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule: A boat moving astern, or sideways to windward, through the water by backing a sail shall keep clear of one that is not.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title:
SECTION D OTHER RULES
22 CAPSIZED, ANCHORED OR AGROUND; RESCUING
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule: If possible, a boat shall avoid a boat that is capsized or has not regained control after capsizing, is anchored or aground, or is trying to help a person or vessel in danger. A boat is capsized when her masthead is in the water.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title:
SECTION D OTHER RULES
 23.1 INTERFERING WITH ANOTHER BOAT
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule: If reasonably possible, a boat not racing shall not interfere with a boat that is racing.

partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Title:
SECTION D OTHER RULES
 23.2 INTERFERING WITH ANOTHER BOAT
partTwoWhenBoatsMeetSectionD.Rule: If reasonably possible, a boat shall not interfere with a boat that is taking a penalty, sailing on another leg or subject to rule 21.1. However, after the starting signal this rule does not apply when the boat is sailing her proper course.
